instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .
definitions.WS_LEFT_SHIFT_KBD: What is WS_LEFT_SHIFT_KBD? This is a signal from the keyboard for the left shift key, which is significantly different from the right shift key when it comes to resetting the SMC/PRAM. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Safe Mode
threads.message:
Liquid damage - other shop tried to fix it.

It boots in most cases to Safe Mode.
I thought keyboard is damaged, but with new keyboard still same issue.

ALT key wont works during boot as well so it looks like SHIFT is pressed all the time.

Booted without keyboard and still same issue.
The only idea what I got is something wrong with Pin 3 on J5713 with line <SIGNAL>WS_LEFT_SHIFT_KBD</SIGNAL> but got no clue how to start.

J5713/3
Diode mode 0.415V

<CHIP>U5701</CHIP> and <CHIP>U5750</CHIP> looks clean and got 0.430V in diode mode on <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>/55 and <CHIP>U5750</CHIP>/9

When it boots then left shift wont works with old and new keyboard (left shift works OK on USB keyboard)

Any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Safe Mode
threads.message: Sounds like the USB "hub" is functioning since external keyboards work. Inspect the keyboard connector.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Safe Mode
threads.message: unplug trackpad, then try pram reset with new keyboard

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Safe Mode
threads.message:
No trackpad has nothing to do with this nor a PRAM reset.

Voltages on pin 1,2,3,4 of keyboard connector? Could be corrosion in the connector between pins 3 and 4 pulling shift key high. Could also be crap under or dead <CHIP>U5750</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Safe Mode
threads.message: SOLVED - resoldered pin 3 on J5713 and works fine. Thank you guys
